newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina revises industrial output forecast up.
newsitem.headline: Argentina revises industrial output forecast up.

text.p: Argentina said Thursday it was revising its forecast for growth in 1997 industrial production up to 6.5-7.0 percent from a 6.0-6.4 estimate issued in March.
"The new projections indicate that there will be an industrial activity growth of between 6.5 and 7.0 percent from last year," Industry and Trade Secretary Alieto Guadagni told reporters.
Industrial output rose 8.0 percent in March compared with the same month a year ago, somewhat higher than the 7.2 percent average estimated by analysts surveyed by Reuters.
Output grew 7.2 percent in the first quarter.
Guadagni's office said the upward review followed a series of good sectorial indicators, including a 44 percent rise in car production in January-April compared with the equivalent 1996 period.

It pointed out that domestic sales of steel, aluminum and cement in the first four months of the year rose by 19 percent, 34 percent and 33 percent, respectively, compared with the same period a year ago.
Cement sales in April were nearly 50 percent higher than in April 1996.
